p: To date, most of the studies on CH 4 fluxes from paddy fields in the cold region of Heilongjiang Province have been site experiments. These experiments revealed the mechanism of CH 4 fluxes from paddy fields in cold regions and provided reliable data support [ 28, 29, 30]. However, it was difficult for these site experiments to estimate CH 4 emissions over a larger area, and the temporal and spatial variation of CH 4 emissions from paddy fields in cold regions under climate change is still unclear. Therefore, the estimation of CH 4 fluxes must rely on the model to expand the sample number of regional CH 4 fluxes, and then assess the potential mitigation measures.
